QualityMeasureDocument.title: NQF 0580 Bipolar Manic Agent
QualityMeasureDocument.text: This measure identifies the percentage of patients with newly diagnosed bipolar disorder who have received at least 1 prescription for a mood-stabilizing agent during the measurement year.

measureAttribute.value: Addresses a Specific National Priority Partners Goal: 5.4. All providers will reduce preventable emergency department (i.e. those that could be avoided with timely access to primary care) visits resulting from poorly coordinated care by 50%. 6.1. All patients will receive high-value care over the course of their acute or chronic illness

American Psychiatric Association. Practice guideline for the treatment of patients with bipolar disorder (revision). Am J Psychiatry. 2002 Apr;159(4 Suppl):1-50. The first-line pharmacological treatment for more severe manic or mixed episodes is the initiation of either lithium plus an antipsychotic or valproate plus an antipsychotic [I]. For less ill patients, monotherapy with lithium, valproate, or an antipsychotic such as olanzapine may be sufficient [I]. The first-line pharmacological treatment for bipolar depression is the initiation of either lithium [I] or lamotrigine [II]. Antidepressant monotherapy is not recommended [I] The medications with the best empirical evidence to support their use in maintenance treatment include lithium [I] and valproate [I]; possible alternatives include lamotrigine [II] or carbamazepine or oxcarbazepine [II].
American Psychiatric Association. Practice guideline for the treatment of patients with bipolar disorder (revision). Am J Psychiatry. 2002 Apr;159(4 Suppl):1-50.
Chou JC, Fazzio L. Maintenance treatment of bipolar disorder: Applying research to clinical practice. J Psychiatr Pract. 2006 Sep;12(5):283?99.

list.item: AND: "Patient Characteristic Birthdate: birth date" >= 17 year(s) starts before start of "Measurement Start Date"
AND: "Initial Patient Population"
AND: Count >= 2 of:"Diagnosis, Active: BH Bipolar Disorder" during ("Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient Encounter" < 1 year(s) starts before start of "Measurement Start Date")

AND: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Bipolar Acute Mania (ordinality: 'Principal Diagnosis')" during ("Encounter, Performed: BH Inpatient Encounter" < 1 year(s) starts before start of "Measurement Start Date")

AND:
OR: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Bipolar Disorder" during ("Encounter, Performed: BH Inpatient Encounter" > 2 year(s) starts before or during "Measurement End Date")
OR: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Bipolar Disorder" starts before start of ("Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient Encounter" > 2 year(s) starts before or during "Measurement End Date")

AND:
OR: "Medication, Order: BH Mood Stabilizing Agents" < 1 year(s) starts before or during "Measurement End Date"
OR: "Medication, Active: BH Mood Stabilizing Agents" during ("Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient Encounter" < 1 year(s) starts before or during "Measurement End Date")
None
